clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of Surgical Completeness After Robotic Thyroidectomy Versus Conventional Open Thyroidectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study of Surgical Completeness After Robotic Thyroidectomy Versus Conventional Open Thyroidectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The robotic thyroidectomy (RT) has excellent cosmetic and several functional results. But there were no definite evidence of oncological safety of robotic thyroidectomy yet. To assure the surgical completeness of robotic thyroidectomy, the investigators compared robotic thyroidectomy and conventional open thyroidectomy (OT) by means of the postoperative radioactive iodine (RAI) uptake of possible remnant thyroid tissue and stimulated TG level.

primary_outcome.measure: surgical completeness of conventional open thyroidectomy and robotic thyroidectomy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after low dose RAI albation therapy
primary_outcome.description: check remnant thyroid uptake at Diagnostic RAI scan and stimulated serum thyroglobulin level

arm_group.description: Group 1 : conventional open thyroidectomy group (papillary thyroid carcinoma patient who underwent conventional open bilateral total thyroidectomy procedure and postoperative low dose RAI therapy)
Group 2 : robotic thyroidectomy group (papillary thyroid carcinoma patient who underwent robotic bilateral total thyroidectomy procedure and postoperative low dose RAI therapy)

study_pop.textblock: papillary thyroid carcinoma patient who underwent conventional open or robotic bilateral total thyroidectomy procedure and postoperative low dose RAI therapy
